intro: Klasea centauroides subsp. strangulata, commonly known as the strangulate klasea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
